meanings.definition: Inclined to silence; reserved in speech; reluctant to join in conversation.
meanings.sent1: The taciturn man preferred listening to talking.
meanings.sent2: She found his taciturn nature calming in a noisy world.
meanings.sent3: The party was so loud that even the usually taciturn librarian started dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her taciturn demeanor spoke volumes in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The taciturn forest enveloped her in a peaceful hush.

meanings.definition: Characterized by silence or lack of speech; habitually silent; reserved.
meanings.sent1: The taciturn cat only meowed when hungry.
meanings.sent2: His taciturn behavior made it hard to know what he was thinking.
meanings.sent3: The taciturn old clock ticked away the hours in solitude.
meanings.sent4: The taciturn mountain stood stoically against the changing sky.
meanings.sent5: The taciturn painting seemed to whisper secrets to those who looked closely.
